title.value: Twins with psychiatric features and a nonsense HRAS variant affecting transcript processing
title.justification: The title of the paper is clearly stated in the beginning.
title.quote: Twins with psychiatric features and a nonsense HRAS variant affecting transcript processing

extractions.description: The paper reports on twins with psychiatric and distinct physical features associated with a novel HRAS variant affecting RNA splicing, expanding the understanding of clinical phenotypes connected to HRAS genetic variations.

type.justification: The paper discusses genetic analysis and splicing without conducting empirical experiments or trials.
type.quote: Here, we report a pair of twins with a distinct HRAS phenotype, due to a de novo nonsense variant which is shown to affect RNA splicing.

name.justification: The study focuses on genetic variants in HRAS affecting transcript processing, related to psychiatric features.
name.quote: Heterozygous germline variants in HRAS can lead to RASopathies.

name.justification: The study examines psychiatric manifestations in conjunction with genetic anomalies.
name.quote: Medical genetic conditions can, in some occasions, be associated with psychiatric features.
